Summary: Cylinder-shiny metal- two colored sections-1 red, 1 black
divs: sighting detailsoccurred : 7\3\2008 11:00 location: raleigh, nc shape: cylinder duration:2 to 3 seconds i was driving roughly westward on the raleigh inner beltline near the six forks rd exit when i saw directly in front of me what obviously was an airliner flying at low speed. it was at extremely low altitude and seemed about 2 or 3 miles away flying just barely above the trees and straight across my path. i stared at it for maybe 2 seconds. it was a long slim cylinder of shiny metal with two colored sections-one red and one black each about 1\3 of the length of the craft. i saw no wings, tail or engines but assumed this was due to looking from the side of the plane and maybe some subtle reflection of sunlight was hiding the tail. also, since it is extremely common to see aircraft approaching nearby raleigh\durham international airport, i instantly dismissed it as an airliner. so i looked slightly away from it to maintain my lane position but glanced right back within about 1 second to confirm what type of plane it was. within that one second it had vanished. i blinked my eyes repeatedly like you see people do in the movies... but due to the craft's low speed and relatively wide sighting area i had in front of me i would have had to look away for at least 5 or 6 seconds to miss it going behind trees and buildings. this event didn't conform to any rational explanation i can think of other than that it was an extremely advanced technology and either departed or became invisible instantaneously. i've read that many new pictures of ufo's are being reported by people who saw nothing while shooting normal pictures with a new digital camera but the objects turned up when they reviewed the images later. i wonder if the human eye can do something akin to this in the right circumstances-where a brief glance might catch the object you can't otherwise see.
